frontMatter.title: Form step
frontMatter.description: A standardized template for creating form pages where Veterans enter information, select options, or upload documents.
frontMatter.intro: Use the form step template to create all pages of a form except for the introduction, review, and confirmation pages. This template handles data entry, selections, and document uploads.

when_to_use.value: **Interior form pages.** Creating interior pages of online forms collecting user information.
**Data entry.** Pages requiring data entry, selections, or document uploads.
**Standard form flow.** Any form step besides introduction, review, or confirmation.

usability.value: **Form steps limit.** Design recommends limiting forms to 13 total steps.
**Single component rule.** In Figma, replace the placeholder with only one component (may be custom local components).
**Breadcrumb consistency.** Remains static across all form step pages.
**Title consistency.** Use identical H1 form title and subtitle across all form pages.
**Pronouns matter.** Specify 'your' only when referring to the form submitter to clarify whose information is requested.

structure.intro: The template has authenticated and unauthenticated variations.

sections.title: Breadcrumb navigation
sections.description: Static navigation across all form step pages.

sections.title: Form title and subtitle
sections.description: Consistent H1 title and form number subtitle.

sections.title: Progress bar - segmented
sections.description: Shows current step with step header.

sections.title: Prefill alert
sections.description: Authenticated only - appears on pages with prefilled data.

sections.title: Form step content
sections.description: Page title and form fields for this step.

sections.title: Finish this application later

sections.title: Autosave alert
sections.description: Authenticated only - success alert showing last saved timestamp.

content_guidelines.value: **Step headers vs page titles.** Step headers identify general information categories ('Your personal information'), while page titles specify details ('Your name and date of birth').
**Body text.** Aim for fewer than fifty words in the body text. Use for clarifying needed information or data usage.
**Hint text.** Provide context helping users select correct responses. Example: 'We'll use your email address to confirm when we receive your form.'
**Additional information.** Reserve for details important to some users but not essential for everyone.

accessibility.value: Each page's H1 must be unique and descriptive.
Authenticated version includes autosave messaging for screen readers.
Unauthenticated version has simplified structure without autosave alerts.
